_comment: TEST CONFIGURATION - ZeroMQ Bridge with 3 Cameras
_description: Generated for testing 3 Windows cameras via ZMQ bridge

system._comment: System-Wide Configuration - Single Source of Truth
system._max_cameras_note: CRITICAL: Maximum cameras supported system-wide (controls buffer allocation, semaphore creation, memory). This is a hard limit - all code references this value. Must be >= startup_mode.camera_count. Default: 10

grid_batching._comment: Grid-based batch inference for MediaPipe landmarks
grid_batching._note: Provides 3-4x speedup by batching all faces into single inference

grid_assignment._comment: Grid-based participant assignment - REPLACES Procrustes tracking
grid_assignment._description: Assigns participant IDs based on spatial grid position combined with embedding-based sticky IDs. Provides O(1) assignment vs expensive Procrustes shape matching.
grid_assignment._layout_note: 2x4 grid = 8 cells for 8 participants. Adjust based on participant_count.
grid_assignment._sticky_note: When enabled, embeddings make participant IDs follow faces across grid cells
grid_assignment._cross_camera_note: When enabled, same person across cameras gets same participant_id. DISABLED until single-camera working.
grid_assignment._embedding_threshold_note: Minimum cosine similarity to keep same participant_id (sticky match). LOWERED from 0.65 to 0.55 to allow more natural face variance (angle/lighting) and prevent over-spawning of IDs.
grid_assignment._impostor_threshold_note: Maximum similarity to detect impostor (new person in occupied cell). Adjusted for corrected [-1,1] scale (was 0.70 on incorrect [0,1] scale).
grid_assignment._grace_period_note: Grace period when face moves between cells (prevents ID flicker)
grid_assignment._timeout_note: Time before participant marked as zombie (not visible). Zombies can be restored via embedding matching when person reappears.
grid_assignment._zombie_timeout_note: Time before zombie participants deleted from memory. 0 = never delete (session-long memory), 3600 = 1 hour. Zombies enable automatic participant restoration after any absence duration via embedding matching.

platform._comment: Platform Detection - Single Switch for WSL2 vs Native Linux
platform._description: Controls camera discovery, GPU backend, and display handling. Set mode='auto' for auto-detection.

mediapipe_processing._min_tracking_confidence_note: LOWERED from 0.5 to 0.3 - allows MediaPipe to track smoothly instead of re-detecting frequently (reduces landmark jitter)
mediapipe_processing._min_face_presence_confidence_note: ADDED: 0.3 - maintains tracking through partial occlusions (prevents re-detection jitter)

pose_smoothing._comment: Temporal smoothing for pose landmarks to reduce jitter
pose_smoothing._description: Exponential moving average (EMA) with occlusion handling. CRITICAL: Uses participant_id (not array index) to prevent cross-participant smoothing.
pose_smoothing._alpha_stable_note: EMA alpha for stable landmarks (nose, shoulders, hips). LOWERED to 0.05 for heavier smoothing (5% current, 95% history)
pose_smoothing._alpha_distal_note: EMA alpha for distal landmarks (wrists, ankles, feet). LOWERED to 0.03 for aggressive smoothing of jittery extremities (3% current, 97% history)
pose_smoothing._alpha_default_note: EMA alpha for other landmarks (elbows, knees, etc.). LOWERED to 0.04 for heavy smoothing (4% current, 96% history)
pose_smoothing._visibility_note: Minimum visibility score to update landmark position. LOWERED to 0.3 to smooth more landmarks even when partially occluded.
pose_smoothing._freeze_note: If true, keep previous smoothed value when occluded. If false, use raw jittery value.

pose_to_participant_matching._comment: CRITICAL FIX: Match poses to participants BEFORE smoothing
pose_to_participant_matching._description: Prevents EMA bug where smoothing was applied across different people when MediaPipe detection order changed.
pose_to_participant_matching._max_distance_note: Maximum pixel distance between pose head centroid and face centroid for valid match. Increase if participants are mismatched.
pose_to_participant_matching._frame_tolerance_note: Relaxed frame sync: search ±20 frames for face data when matching poses. INCREASED from 3 to handle 15 FPS pose vs 30 FPS face detection (up to 15-frame gap).
pose_to_participant_matching._fallback_note: If head centroid calculation fails, use body centroid (shoulders/hips) as fallback.

gpu_acceleration._description: Enables NVIDIA GPU acceleration for frame processing and overlay rendering. Provides 5-10x speedup over CPU.
gpu_acceleration._profile_note: Set to true to log detailed GPU performance statistics
gpu_acceleration._cache_note: Number of GPU buffers to pre-allocate per frame resolution
gpu_acceleration._async_note: Use CUDA streams for asynchronous GPU operations
gpu_acceleration._batch_note: Process multiple camera frames in batches for better GPU utilization

gpu_drawing._landmarks_note: GPU landmark drawing (experimental - limited OpenCV CUDA support)

zmq_camera_bridge._comment: ZeroMQ Camera Bridge - Auto-Enumeration Mode with Discovery Service
zmq_camera_bridge._description: When enabled, automatically discovers and connects to all Windows cameras via ZMQ. NEW: Uses manifest-based discovery for 100% reliability!
zmq_camera_bridge._zmq_max_cameras_note: ZMQ-specific camera limit (independent of system camera_count)
zmq_camera_bridge._detected_resolution_note: Auto-detected resolution from first ZMQ camera stream. Set automatically by GUI, do not edit manually. If null, uses default_resolution until first camera connects.
zmq_camera_bridge._connection_timeout_ms_note: Timeout for legacy port-by-port probing per camera (15s, increased from 6s for reliability)
zmq_camera_bridge._discovery_description: Windows broadcasts camera manifest on discovery_port. WSL receives manifest and waits for all cameras. 100% reliable vs. old probing method!
zmq_camera_bridge._enable_manifest_discovery_note: Set to false to use legacy port-by-port probing (not recommended)
zmq_camera_bridge._discovery_port_note: Port for Windows discovery service (separate from camera streams)
zmq_camera_bridge._discovery_timeout_ms_note: Timeout for receiving manifest from Windows (20s, increased from 10s for reliability)
zmq_camera_bridge._camera_connection_timeout_ms_note: Timeout for waiting for all cameras to connect after manifest received (60s, increased from 30s for reliability)

camera_settings._comment: Global Camera Defaults - Applied to all cameras when using ZMQ auto-enumeration
camera_settings._description: All cameras use these defaults. No per-camera config needed - truly plug-and-play!
camera_settings._use_mapped_memory_note: CUDA mapped pinned memory disabled by default - prevents GUI blocking in WSL2

camera_timeouts._comment: Timeouts for camera initialization and handshake (WSL2 GPU warmup takes 45-90s)

startup_mode._camera_count_note: System camera count for buffer allocation and face recognition (use zmq_max_cameras for ZMQ bridge)

logging._verbose_debug_note: Enable detailed per-frame debug logs (LSL, pose, correlator, etc.). Set to true for debugging, false for production.

gui_processing._max_frame_lag_note: LIFO optimization: Skip frames older than N frames behind latest (0=disabled, 1=aggressive, 2=balanced, 3+=conservative)

theme._description: Controls the appearance of the GUI with light/dark mode support
theme._mode_note: Current theme mode - 'light' or 'dark'. Can be toggled at runtime via the theme toggle button.

canvas._pose_skeleton_opacity_note: Opacity for pose skeleton overlay (0.0=invisible, 1.0=fully opaque). Default: 0.4 (40% opacity)

participant_management._STAGE_1_LOCAL: GridParticipantManager - Per-camera grid + embedding assignment (see 'grid_assignment' section)
participant_management._STAGE_2_GLOBAL: GlobalParticipantManager - Cross-camera matching using face embeddings (see 'global_manager' section below)
participant_management._KEY_DIFFERENCE: GridParticipantManager uses spatial grid + embeddings (O(1) assignment). GlobalParticipantManager uses embeddings for cross-camera matching (100%).

enrollment._min_samples_note: INCREASED to 90 samples - very high quality enrollment, prevents false enrollments
enrollment._min_quality_note: TEMPORARILY LOWERED to 0.40 for diagnostic testing (was 0.55) - will revert after diagnosing enrollment issues
enrollment._min_consistency_note: INCREASED from 0.75 to 0.80 - embeddings must be more consistent across samples
enrollment._min_stability_note: INCREASED from 0.75 to 0.78 - require better temporal stability
enrollment._collection_timeout_note: Timeout for sample collection phase (90 samples at 30fps = ~3 seconds, with quality filtering ~30-45 seconds)

validation_criteria._consistency_note: REDUCED from 0.88 to 0.80 - achievable with real face data, prevents validation failures
validation_criteria._stability_note: REDUCED from 0.82 to 0.80 - reasonable temporal stability threshold

face_recognition._similarity_threshold_note: REDUCED from 0.9 to 0.85 - allow matching with good confidence while maintaining quality
face_recognition._update_threshold_note: REDUCED from 0.8 to 0.75 - update embeddings more frequently for better adaptation

participant_tracking._DEPRECATED: DEPRECATED - UnifiedTracker removed in favor of GridParticipantManager
participant_tracking._REPLACED_BY: GridParticipantManager - Grid-based spatial assignment + embedding sticky IDs (see 'grid_assignment' section)
participant_tracking._WHY_REMOVED: Procrustes shape matching was expensive (O(n^2)) and unreliable. Grid + embeddings provides O(1) assignment with better accuracy.
participant_tracking._NOTE: Settings below are unused and kept for historical reference only.

weights._PURPOSE: Weights for frame-to-frame tracking WITHIN a single camera (no face recognition available yet)
weights._shape_weight_note: Procrustes distance between landmark shapes (100% - position disabled for robust ID stability)
weights._position_weight_note: DISABLED - Spatial position no longer used (prevents ID swaps when participants swap locations)

global_manager._DESCRIPTION: Matches participants across multiple cameras using face embeddings. Runs AFTER GridParticipantManager assignment.
global_manager._PURPOSE: Ensures same person gets same participant_id across all cameras (e.g., Camera 0 P1 = Camera 1 P1)
global_manager._NOTE: This is DIFFERENT from GridParticipantManager (per-camera grid assignment). This handles GLOBAL identity across cameras.
global_manager._recognition_threshold_note: Reduced from 0.7 for more permissive face recognition matching

weights._UPDATED: 2025-01-22 - Changed to 100% face recognition (disabled shape/position fallback)
weights._recognition_weight_note: Set to 1.0 - FACE RECOGNITION ONLY (100%). No fallback to shape/position.
weights._shape_weight_note: Set to 0.0 - Procrustes shape matching DISABLED for cross-camera matching
weights._position_weight_note: Set to 0.0 - Position matching DISABLED for cross-camera matching (position meaningless across cameras)

cache_settings._embedding_similarity_threshold_note: INCREASED from 0.75 to 0.85 - much stricter matching to prevent ID swaps when participants swap locations (biometric-only matching)

cross_camera_matching._comment: Cross-camera participant merging via face recognition - STRICT to prevent different people getting same ID
cross_camera_matching._merge_threshold_note: KEEP at 0.90 - VERY STRICT threshold to prevent false cross-camera merges (different people assigned same ID)

locking._comment: Participant Lock System - Prevents ID Theft and Enables Strict Face-Name Pairing
locking._description: Lock participants after enrollment to prevent impostors from stealing IDs. Locked participants require stricter embedding match (0.85 vs normal 0.65).
locking._lock_threshold_note: Stricter threshold for locked participants (0.85 vs normal 0.65) - prevents false matches
locking._show_absent_note: Display 'P{id} 🔒 - Absent' in GUI when locked participant is not in frame
locking._usage_note: Click lock button next to participant name after enrollment completes (green outline). Locked participants survive recently_lost timeout indefinitely.

bluetooth_settings._reconnect_retries_note: Number of automatic reconnection attempts before giving up
bluetooth_settings._reconnect_backoff_note: Exponential backoff delays for reconnection attempts (milliseconds)

bluetooth_bridge._comment: ZeroMQ Bluetooth Bridge - Windows to WSL2
bluetooth_bridge._description: Receives Bluetooth data from Windows bridge via ZMQ (similar to camera bridge)
bluetooth_bridge._base_port_note: Base port for Bluetooth bridges. Changed from 5560 to 5650 to avoid camera port conflicts (cameras use 5550-5560).
bluetooth_bridge._port_range_note: Data port range for up to 19 Bluetooth devices (5651-5669). Port 5650 reserved for discovery.
bluetooth_bridge._discovery_port_note: Port for manifest broadcast (device discovery). Individual devices stream on 5651+.
